derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin intersectio(n-), from intersecare (see intersect)

entry.tran: 交点;道路交叉口;十字路口
entry.def: An intersection is a place where roads or other lines meet or cross.

means.word_mean: 2. a junction where one street or road crosses another
3. a point or set of points common to two or more geometric configurations
4. the set of elements common to two or more sets;

sentences.sentence: "the set of red hats is the intersection of the set of hats and the set of red things"

means.word_mean: 5. a representation of common ground between theories or phenomena;

sentences.sentence: "there was no overlap between their proposals"

means.word_mean: 6. the act of intersecting (as joining by causing your path to intersect your target's path)

stems_affixes.word_buile: sect切,割+arian……的,有人的意思→把人群分开的→搞宗派的
section[[n.章节,部分;地区,部门,科;截面,剖面]]糠?al……的→adj.可组合的
dissect[v.解剖;详细研究]+ion表名词→n.解剖,切开
in进入+sect切,割→昆虫一节一节如被切开
